name: Bejad Roti
history: Bejad Roti is a traditional Indian flatbread originating from the Rajasthan region. It's known for its nutritious value, being made from a mix of whole grain flours.
description: Bejad Roti is a healthier version of the regular roti or Indian flatbread. It is typically made from a combination of wheat flour and millet flour, offering a rich, nutty flavor and a hearty texture.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine wheat flour, jowar flour, bajra flour, and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a smooth and pliable dough.

instructions.title: Roll the Rotis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and then flatten it using a rolling pin to form a thin, round roti.

instructions.title: Cook the Roti
instructions.description: Heat a flat pan or griddle on medium heat. Place the rolled-out roti on the pan and cook until small bubbles appear. Flip and cook the other side, applying ghee or oil as needed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Bejad Roti hot, ideally with a vegetarian or non-vegetarian curry, dal, or any Indian side dish of your choice.

tips: Ensure the dough is neither too soft nor too stiff for the best results.
You can add a pinch of ajwain (carom seeds) to the dough for added flavor.
variations: Mix in finely chopped herbs like cilantro or mint for a flavorful twist.
Experiment with different flour ratios to suit your taste and dietary needs.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh, but can be stored for a day in an airtight container.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a pan or in a microwave before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a pan for a minute on each side or in a microwave for 20-30 seconds.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional Indian thali for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a side of sliced onions and lemon wedges.
